meta.description: The Centurion Lounge at Miami International Airport (MIA), North Terminal, Concourse D. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: The Centurion Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Across from Gate D14 on Level 4.

location.description: QMI, Miami-Dade County, Florida, United States

lounge.description:
From the moment you walk in, you'll see that things are different here. Unexpected touches like a locally-inspired menu, a family room, and a well-appointed shower suite meet productive workspaces with high-speed Wi-Fi.

Learn more at thecenturionlounge.com/locations/mia/

regulatory: The Centurion Lounge is a day of departure lounge. Arriving Platinum and Delta SkyMiles Reserve Card Members with boarding passes for flights that have just landed will not be admitted.

Platinum and Delta SkyMiles Reserve Card Members will not be admitted more than 3 hours before the departure time on their same-day, confirmed boarding pass. This does not apply to Platinum and Delta SkyMiles Reserve Card Members with a connecting flight.

reviews.content: Long narrow lounge. Several different buffets with different options. Two bars and good drinks. Bathrooms clean and nice. Food was substantial, enough for a meal. Must exit security to fly United.
Cool views. Love the specialty drinks at the bar!
Puts Admirals Club to shame. Some speak of overcrowding....maybe I caught it on a good day? Yes there are people here but nothing prohibitive.
It's OK, had breakfast ....not cozy and a bit noisy. No big deal.
Good seats. Great service at the bar. Barmaid was so nice! Soap smells so good! Haha.
The lounge is a bit bigger then in Dallas. The food offer is okay. I would have expected a little bit more. I would prefer to use the lounge in Dallas to this one, if it fits my flight schedule.
Excellent location, staff with a lot of courtesy and kindness, excellent variety of food and drinks. All available to make an excellent stay regardless of time. I really recommend it.
Very accommodating, but I wasn't impressed by the food. For all the hype of it being a Centurion Lounge, I expected something better than dry chicken. Otherwise it was a nice reprieve from MIA.
Plenty of space after you walk beyond the first room. Good food. Solid Bloody Mary. Pleasant and eager service. Great view. Great first Centurion lounge experience.
Always enjoy Centurion but this was my best experience on 4 hour layover. Delicious beef brisket on farro, good IPAs brought to my table by friendly staff. Tips well deserved.
Entrei no lounge assim que abriu, 5:00am, e jÃ¡ tinha uma fila para entrar. NÃ£o tinha muitas opÃ§Ãµes para comer e nÃ£o tem um lugar  para descanso. Mesmo cedo estava cheio no momento em que sai.
Not sure why everyone crowds around the initial lounge area when there is a MASSIVE space. Be sure to walk down the hall and stretch out! Spacious and calming lounge. Perfect after a red-eye!
Busy lounge but large and nice spa.
Very busy. Few choices. Lounge closes at 10:00pm and there are flights leaving after 11:00.

Very small. One of the smallest clubs Iâ€™ve been in especially for the Centurion brand. If you have Admirals Club access, it's right next to it and itâ€™s much larger. Stop in Centurion for a bit better.
Turned away on an inbound flight terminating in MIA. Turned away for a flight that was 3 hours before departure.
Turned away because my flight is more than 3 hours in future. If I'd known that I wouldn't have come to airport early. What's the point of paying for Priority Pass/Amex Platinum if it doesn't work?
Food quality is going down and it is very, very busy. There are often no seats.
What a waste. Totally overcrowded. Food was mediocre. Better value at the AA lounge next door.
Crowded lounge but great drinks, food, and view in this wonderful respite.
Pretty solid lounge. Good cocktail. Food is OK. Nice bar with full service. Very crowded, getting more and more people each time. Removed a star again.
In violation of health code, dogs in the eating area â€” not in container â€” sitting on a chair.
I very much enjoy getting a seat by the window and having a few drinks between flights. I have not been a huge fan of the food, but the salads and cookies are pretty amazing.
For something that is so hyped, I wish it were better. This should be an elite lounge, itâ€™s not. Most Delta lounges have them beat.
A great lounge that is so over crowded it canâ€™t help but fall a star behind. They are working on a 5000sqft upgrade that hopefully will make it a luxury again. Still great food great service.
Very few food choices, no water bottles/soda or snacks to take on the go, two male bathroom stalls in the entire lounge (no changing rooms). Super crowded and underwhelming.
Crowded, LOUD, limited food choices (spareribs, polenta, soup, slack beer). Long & skinny so hard to get away from foot traffic. Probably beats SEA for least impressive Centurion Lounge.
Great staff, food & the included mini spa services are lovely. Good tarmac & runway views. But WOW does it get busy. I've been to almost every AmEx lounge & in the evening, this is the busiest.
Best Centurion Club!! Staff very professional, attentive and friendly. Lounge is clean, constantly replenished. Vanessa is awesome. Seating ample.
Great lounge, but super crowded! Found seating across from the member services desk. Yummy food and drinks.
The good...Food was flavorful. Great view of the runway. The bad..... overcrowded. Not enough seats. Served the same meal all day. Not as clean as other Cent. lounges. Adults w/o kids in Family Room.
Great lounge, good coffee.  Monday afternoon, not too crowded. Got a massage and staff was helpful to find a bag of ice for me to put into my cooler to keep my fish I caught cold.
One of my favorite US lounges. There's plenty of great food and beverage choices. Only negative is there is never enough seating.
Clean. Food mostly salad bar. Drinks OK. Really overcrowded. Usually 1 chair open in whole place. Chairs not real comfortable. Few outlets. Guests arriving seemed to act entitled or something.
Amazing lounge at MIA Airport, clean, good food. It's crowded but yet comfortable.
A nice lounge in a nice airport. Luis helped us out looking up one of our cards since we had left it at home. Crowded, but calm and the food was delicious. Friendly staff all around.
Amex severely underestimated the size of the crowds for this club. The club is outstanding but the 5+ times I've been in here it was SRO.
Another fantastic AMEX lounge with an alluring concourse entry and interesting wrap-around design. No complaints to report.
Best AMEX lounge so far. Modern and clean with great service and surprisingly good food. Can't complain with the bar selection and service.
Unable to use Amex in Cuba so didn't carry it. Can buy anything, anywhere by entering card #. Wrongly assumed I could pay for an extra guest. No, you cannot.  It's 1989 at the Club!!
One of the best lounges in the country. Very open and bright, great food and drink selection. Massage service available, make appointment when checking in.
Super nice lounge in MIA. Way better than the crappy AA ones and with much better food and excellent drink selection. I won't be setting foot at another American Lounge again.
A bit far from concourse E but it interconnects with D.
I was surprised by the size at first, but if you want quieter, more comfy space, go back out by the front desk and turn into the curved wings. Plenty of seating & very quiet there.
Nice lounge, great food selection and helpful staff.
Great lounge. Good food, good drinks, can't miss.
Centurion lounges always impress. Good food, cocktails, and space. I went at 6pm on a weekday and it wasn't bad. The Key Lime Gimlet is amazing!
It's quite crowded, but typically has decent food.
The lounge is on the small side so it gets loud and crowded. It is a clean and well-appointed though so it will probably be better if you go during off peak hours.
Great lounge but too small. Very hard to find seating.
Excelente Lounge. Buena comida y excelente servicio e instalaciones. La comida es variada y en porciones adecuadas.
Lounge is super busy Sunday evening - had to hunt/wait for seats, wait for service at bar, and food was quickly emptied by patrons - not worth the effort.
Really excellent food. But too small and too busy. They were clearing the tables quickly, but we got one of the only open tables. Spa was fully booked through closing (8pm), at more than an hour out.

I love these lounges everywhere, even the satellite in Seattle.. But, Miami is half the size it needs to be, it's sloppy, and the front desk staff are rude. Showers are never available and spa is a wish.
Wonderful except it's overcrowded and cups are left on tables.
Standard Centurion Lounge. Great overall but too small and crowded. Very good breakfast food offerings.
Busier than the terminal. Paltry food selection. Insufficient seating. Be prepared to wait in line for the bathroom (men too!).
We arrived late, so it wasn't crowded at all. The staff was extremely friendly making sure we had everything we needed before the kitchen and bar closed for the evening.
I arrived early to spend time in the lounge and not face brutal morning rush hour. It was not a bad decision! Even if your flight is at the opposite end of the terminal, there is a train, so stop by!
Quite similar to the size in DFW, regular breakfast start at 6am. No chance to take showers, not sure the water pressure.ðŸ˜ƒ
Good lounge but very crowded.

Although a Centurion lounge the place is always packed to the gills. Also the food was not as good as other Centurions. Service was also nonexistent. I think they had 1 person cleaning in a packed room.
Food was tasty and service good. However, this is an extremely busy airport so the space may seem cramped due to popularity of the space.
Food is pretty good but not many selections. Bloody Marys are terrible.
Good healthy food options, a bit light on cocktail menu options. Not big and can get very busy but has exhale spa options.
Sadly lounge often so crowded people end up sitting on floor. Staff seems overwhelmed. Want to love the place but experience hardly ideal.
I love the idea of Centurion Lounges, but this (like SFO) is so crowded that it feels like a contact sport. There is usually be a two hour wait for massages, and the men's room is too small.
Expected a bit more from AmEx, not too impressed. Sterile and limited plugs. Food is excellent though.
Excellent, first time using, it was fabulous. Our family loved it, excellent food, kitchen staff, wait staff, bar staff, and check in staff. We love it and will be back!  ER
Visited two times and love the food, drinks and the awesome views of the American Airlines planes on the tarmac. It can get crowded both in the mornings and evenings.
Centurions are great but Dallas and LaGuardia are a lot better. This one didn't have the same food options or layout. Still worth going to.
Good selection at bar. Good isn't up to other Centurion Lounges. Simple buffet.
Good food. Great service. Excellent bar.
The lounge is relatively small for the large number of people.
All the great food, beverage, and service one would expect from a Centurion. The lounge can get a bit busy and the single shower room can have long wait lists. Otherwise a great lounge.
Had an incredibly good lunch buffet, offering several gourmet items. Visit was quick, and easy.
It would be perfect if it was just a little larger. But everything else is outstanding. Food is delicious, drinks easy to get, reception gracious, spa amazing (at least the massage). Well done Amex!
Food, decor, and service all excellent.  Great view.

location.terminalDirections: After security, on the 3rd Floor above Gate D15.

location.description: QMI, Miami-Dade County, Florida, United States

location.terminalDirections: After security, across from Gate D30
